headline: Trade Desk Stock Jumps After Company Added to S&P 500
summary: The Trade Desk  will be added to the S&P 500 index prior to the opening of trading on Friday.  It will replace  Ansys  which is being purchased by S&P 500 constituent  Synopsys  on Thursday, according to S&P Dow Jones Indices.  Shares of Trade Desk, which provides a platform for advertising buyers, were sharply higher in after-hours trading, gaining 14.6% to $86.41 after being little changed in regular trading Monday.

raw.headline: Trade Desk Stock Jumps After Company Added to S&P 500
raw.summary: The Trade Desk  will be added to the S&P 500 index prior to the opening of trading on Friday.  It will replace  Ansys  which is being purchased by S&P 500 constituent  Synopsys  on Thursday, according to S&P Dow Jones Indices.  Shares of Trade Desk, which provides a platform for advertising buyers, were sharply higher in after-hours trading, gaining 14.6% to $86.41 after being little changed in regular trading Monday.

headline: The Trade Desk Set to Join S&P 500
summary: The Trade Desk Inc. (NASD: TTD) will replace ANSYS Inc. (NASD: ANSS) in the S&P 500 effective prior to the opening of trading on Friday, July 18. S&P 500 constituent Synopsys Inc. (NASD: SNPS) will acquire ANSYS in a deal expected to be completed on July 17.

headline: Synopsys Clears Final Regulatory Hurdle for $35B Ansys Deal
summary: Chip design software provider Synopsys said it received conditional approval from Chinese regulators for its $35 billion purchase of Ansys, clearing the final regulatory hurdle for the deal.

headline: Tesla & xAI, Kenvue, Synopsys–Ansys deal: Trending Tickers
summary: Tesla (TSLA) CEO Elon Musk said he doesn't support a merger of the electric vehicle (EV) pioneer and his artificial intelligence (AI) company, xAI (XAAI.PVT). Musk has signaled that Tesla investors could vote on whether to invest in xAI at the upcoming shareholder meeting. Kenvue (KVUE) CEO is stepping down as pressure from activist investors intensifies. Chinese regulators approved the deal between Synopsys (SNPS) and Ansys (ANSS). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Synopsys Receives All Necessary Approvals for Proposed Acquisition of Ansys
summary: Synopsys, Inc. (Nasdaq: SNPS) today announced that it has received approval from all necessary authorities to proceed with the acquisition of ANSYS, Inc. (Nasdaq: ANSS). The parties expect to close the transaction on or about Thursday, July 17, 2025, subject to the satisfaction or waiver of the remaining customary closing conditions.

raw.headline: Synopsys Receives All Necessary Approvals for Proposed Acquisition of Ansys

headline: China grants conditional approval for Synopsys to acquire Ansys
summary: BEIJING (Reuters) -China's market regulator has conditionally approved the acquisition of simulation software company Ansys by U.S. software firm Synopsys', the State Administration for Market Regulation said on Monday.  The approval comes after the United States lifted restrictions on exports to China for chip design software developers earlier this month, allowing companies, including Synopsys, to restore access to their software and technology for Chinese customers.
